name: Simple Milk Bread
author: Britaini Parris
summary: I was taught this recipe by a teacher and he swears by this recipe. This recipe is a lot like a brioche, but I prefer this because it taste less like eggs.
directions: Combine bread flour, sugar, salt, and yeast in the bowl of a stand mixer using the dough hook on low speed; mix in eggs until fully incorporated
Mix in warm water and milk until fully incorporated
Add butter and mix until fully incorporated
Continue mixing until dough holds together
Take a piece of dough between your fingers and pull them apart
If the dough stays connected and becomes translucent, it is ready
Add milk or flour if needed to reach this consistency
Allow dough to rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour
Divide dough into 4 or 5 loaves and shape into greased loaf pans
Rise again until edges are roughly 1 inch below the top of the pan, 30 to 60 minutes
Create a 2-inch vertical slit across the top of each loaf using a knife or scissors
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake in the preheated oven until bread reaches an internal temperature of 200 degrees F (93 degrees C), about 20 minutes
